alert.note: Alert for Southwest Wyoming (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 19 at 7:59PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Weber... southeastern Cache...southern Rich...northern Morgan...northwestern Summit and northwestern Uinta Counties through 845 PM MDT... At 759 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles north of Morgan to 16 miles north of Coalville. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Woodruff, Huntsville, Almy, Mountain Green, Causey Reservoir and Peterson. This includes the following highways... Interstate 84 between mile markers 92 and 97. Interstate 80 in Utah near mile marker 195. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
